DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the gene delivery viral vector.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A genetic element that is able to move from one genomic position to another.

Concepts.definition: A genetic element that is able to move from one genomic position to another.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A family of viruses that possess RNA-dependent DNA polymerases (reverse transcriptases) and contain two identical molecules of positive sense, single-stranded RNA of high molecular weight.  This RNA serves as a template for the synthesis of a complementary DNA, which may be integrated into the host DNA. Virions are enveloped.

Concepts.definition: A family of viruses that possess RNA-dependent DNA polymerases (reverse transcriptases) and contain two identical molecules of positive sense, single-stranded RNA of high molecular weight.  This RNA serves as a template for the synthesis of a complementary DNA, which may be integrated into the host DNA. Virions are enveloped.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A genus of the family Retroviridae consisting of non-oncogenic retroviruses that produce multi-organ diseases characterized by long incubation periods and persistent infection. Lentiviruses are unique in that they contain open reading frames (ORFs) between the pol and env genes and in the 3' env region. Five serogroups are recognized, reflecting the mammalian hosts with which they are associated. HIV-1 is the type species.

Concepts.definition: A genus of the family Retroviridae consisting of non-oncogenic retroviruses that produce multi-organ diseases characterized by long incubation periods and persistent infection. Lentiviruses are unique in that they contain open reading frames (ORFs) between the pol and env genes and in the 3' env region. Five serogroups are recognized, reflecting the mammalian hosts with which they are associated. HIV-1 is the type species.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A recombinant adeno-associated virus genome that has been engineered to carry a sequence of interest between viral inverted terminal repeats for packaging into a virus capsid and transduction into a mammalian cell.

Concepts.definition: A recombinant adeno-associated virus genome that has been engineered to carry a sequence of interest between viral inverted terminal repeats for packaging into a virus capsid and transduction into a mammalian cell.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
